intro: Pasania hancei var. arisanensis, commonly known as the Arisan pasania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is primarily found in mountainous regions of Taiwan and parts of southern China. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less commonly cultivated species.
